website_summaries.verdict: A good budget option for anyone wanting to learn to use a drill press without investing a lot of money.
pros: The small one-third horsepower motor provides plenty of torque to drill through most soft substances like wood
Drill bits are easy to change out using the included key
Includes a half-inch keyed chuck and onboard key storage
cons: Drill press is prone to binding up in dense or thick materials like certain metals

website_summaries.verdict: Novices may find its feature and functions acceptable; otherwise, we recommend considering others on our shortlist.
pros: The base, table, and drill head are all made of cast iron, giving rigidity where it's needed most
cons: As an entry-level tool, it is not packed with features

customer_reviews.title: Chuck keeps falling off, don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a headache since day 1. The chuck falls off every other time. Probably going to return it while I still can which will be an even bigger headache due to the weight. UPDATE. The seller has phenomenal customer service. So I'm changing my rating to 4 stars. They replaced the entire drill press and it arrived a day after I got the email. On a Sunday at that.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: A great press for the money
customer_reviews.text: A great simple press. I needed a press to machine 6016 aluminum to finish lower AR receivers. To do this I needed to make straight holes and I needed enough power to get through the alloy. I put the belt on the second to highest torque setting, which would mean the second to slowest speed and the press worked great. Everything on this press is rough. It's not a work of art, but it is strong, relatively light and it will make holes. If that's all you need then look no further. When I use this press I clamp it to my work bench, then put it under for storage. A larger press would make moving it much more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K.

customer_reviews.title: 001 and better, buy something bigger/more expensive
customer_reviews.text: Wen might be my new go to brand. Yes, there is a little bit of flex between the post and the actual machine head but it was not enough to cause significant drill deflection, even at max throw and minimum chuck. And anyways, if you want to run +/- .001 and better, buy something bigger/more expensive. I'm not making medical devices in my garage, I'm drilling holes. Are you drilling holes? Get this drill press.
customer_reviews.author: clint W.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little drill press
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal if you are in the market for an economical drill press. I am surprised by the quality of the unit thusfar. It should retail for $100 based on what you get. I paid slightly more than half that, a great deal. It had no trouble drilling through a 2x4 with a 1-3/4" forstner bit on the lowest speed. It does have it's limits though and if you try to power through too hard, the belt will slip. That said, it's not a heavy duty unit bit should be fine for light use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris232

customer_reviews.title: Springs Break
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 of these and the springs that raise the unit up have all broken. I originally called and they sent a replacement part for the first one. The replacement part was different. I guess they realized they were weak. I called in and they charged me for the other 3 after they all broke. after over 15 mins. on the phone they discounted them to try to make me feel better. Since then all the replacement springs have broken. I called and waited 37 minutes to be told the springs are not out of stock. Now I'm stuck! Crappy parts, crappy warranty= unhappy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Not Even Capable Of Doing Basic Drilling
customer_reviews.text: Even with brand new bits specifically for drilling steel, this drill press has a hard time drilling 1/8 in. steel. I am not impressed at all. It simply does not have enough power. It has stopped on every simple thing I had needed it for, even drilling into 3/4 in. wood. I regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: B. Winckler

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup it took less than 10 minutes. Lots of YouTube vids on setup. I got this for drilling holes for knife blanks and handles.
customer_reviews.author: anthony miller

customer_reviews.title: Chuck wobbles no matter what I do
customer_reviews.text: This is useless as the chuck wobbles out of true at least .5 mm.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: has no balls, its rusting after 2 days. It falls apart. It quits on 2x4 3/4 thru. this is not direct drive. and on steel very tedious going thru it.
customer_reviews.author: MASTER REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Not for hardwood
customer_reviews.text: Bogs down to nothing trying to drill into a half inch piece of hard maple. Barely “scratched the surface”. Drill doesn’t cut it. Very disappointed. Should have listened to the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: ICUNVNME

customer_reviews.title: This could be one of our best purchases this year
customer_reviews.text: This could be one of our best purchases this year. We use it in manufacturing, have only had it a week, but every bit as good as the very expensive JET drill press we also own. It's just a baby, but great for smaller stuff. We like very much. UPDATE 12-28-2017 ================= Still works like a champ! For the price and size, it's a great little tool. The main thing with a drill press is that the spindle stays on a nice axis and the motor doesn't die. I think we'll have it for quite a few more years, but even it it died today, job well done little guy!!
customer_reviews.author: JoeyLeePM

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Drill bit wobbles.... Everything else works fine but that's the most important part...
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Too much runout for precision use.
customer_reviews.text: Too much runout for precision use. I bought one and exchanged it because it had a wobble, and the replacement had the same wobble. The tapers were clean, and I tried reinstalling the chucks. The error was in the output shaft's taper, and I confirmed it with a dial indicator. Nice sized machine and features, but not precise enough for what I wanted it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Extremely unhappy with this purchase very low quality no power Should have spent the extra money on a JET
customer_reviews.author: larry cowart

customer_reviews.title: Recommend buying a different drill press.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is an okay drill press but I should have paid a little more and got better features. Pros: Easy to assemble. Price is reasonable. Solid construction. Power is okay but be sure to use a well sharpened bit. I drilled through a mental hollow post and the drill performed okay. Cons: Pain to adjust the work platform, it slides up and down rather than notched increments. The travel length of the bit is only 2 inches, I knew that when purchasing it but thought 2 inches was adequate, it’s not for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Ed D

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This machine is the same as the harbor freight drill press... with a couple of important differences. The casting on the base and table are much thicker then the harbor freight version. I actually broke the drill table collar on the harbor freight version when I was assembling it. I had no issues with this machine and I have used it several times so far and found it to be acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: gfang

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite orange tool
customer_reviews.text: This drill press is okay for small things but it's not a joy to use. The handles are not very solid and the spring is far too strong for the unit so you really have to push compared to other models I own. Overall it is useable but I don't think I would buy again Pros- decent tolerances, sufficient power, good table Cons- handles suck, not the best adjustment method for height of table, spring is too strong
customer_reviews.author: ZD

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and not very powerful, but effective.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for.. cheap unit, low power. Multiple belt configurations on drive wheel assembly, which achieves 5 speeds, low torque on all settings however. That said, for the price it does do the job slow and steady. It’s cheap built, and I don’t have high hopes for longevity because of that... but you never know.
customer_reviews.author: ChazinPA

customer_reviews.title: This is a BASIC drill press.  But it works!
customer_reviews.text: Adjusting the table is a pain in the ass (no crank - you loosen, slide, tighten - three hands might be useful). There's no adjustable stop on the handle, so repeated holes to a specified depth means screwing around trying to nudge the table up and down before re-tightening it and hoping it didn't move a millimeter. The depth of travel is pretty limiting. All that said... It's quiet. It drills straight. If you only use one occasionally, or have more time than money, this is the one for you. It does what a drill press does adequately and most importantly CHEAPLY. If you're a woodworker who uses one daily, you'll go insane fiddling with the table constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Lacheur

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice packaging protects drill press. Easy to put together. Thick steel construction (heavy) and nice orange and black paint job. Return spring squeaks but works well. I unscrewed the knob on the belt cover but not required to open cover. Don't like the spring loaded chuck key that pushes key out of chuck (unless you push in) but it's probably a required safety feature to keep the lawyers happy. Decent size motor for such a small drill. This drill looks like it will last a long time and the price is relatively cheap. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mendenhall

customer_reviews.title: Works well and good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I've only had it a short time and used it a few times. So far it has been great. It was easy to put together and spins up nice and smooth. I don't know how it would last if being used everyday for hours per day, but for the typical home use I think it's a good value. There is a little flex but unless you are needing incredibly tight precision it should be fine for most things. It holds well for me ..probably close to 0.1mm ..depending on material and drill bit being used. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Make sure about stroke travel
customer_reviews.text: I only have two issues. Mine is in the garage and the vertical table bar and the chuck are showing rust. Not a good sign. Also VERY important. If you are new to drill presses, which I was, I did not realize that they don't all travel the same distance. So mine can only go two inches deep. I'm actually needing 4-5, so I will be shopping. This is a fine tool for the price. I wish they'd throw some stainless steel in to the parts, but it works fine. Just know how deep you need to go before buying!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Tolerances extremely Loosey Goosey..... but this worked for me just fine!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in conjunction with my bench grinder to grind down teeth for my stump grinder- the excessive radial tolerance allowed for excessive movement of the grinding wheel- this helped me. The motor, however, would get SO HOT I feared it would burn out. I purchased a $10 desk fan from "Big Lots" and adapted it onto the fan end of the motor. I STILL had to turn in off every 10 minutes to cool down. Note: I checked this without a load as well- same result. I called their 1800 (American sales support)- they answered (small miracle in todays' commerce). They said up to 150 degrees F. was normal....OKAY..... I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D King

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the attached photos, this product must have been damaged at the factory but still passed QA and was packaged and mailed damaged. The box itself was without damage and the contents were secure within the foam which is why it must have been damaged at the factory. Also the lock key is so loose that it falls out with the slightest bump meaning that it'll easily get lost sometime in the future. Product works and is worth it at the $67 price point but quality is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: E.R.

customer_reviews.title: Great little bench top drill press
customer_reviews.text: I was considering purchasing a similar drill press from harbor freight but after watching several “You Tube” videos I decided to purchase the Wen. I am really glad I did. As a RETIRED Tool & Die Maker, I have spent many hours running all types of machines including Drill Presses. This little Wen runs smooth and has a lot of features for the money. That’s my PROFESSIONAL opinion,
customer_reviews.author: sbcoach

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, heavy and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: It’s an $80 drill press. I was surprised by the weight and heft. How the heck can anyone make money selling this thing? The shipping alone you’d think would cost $80. Anyway, I’m happy with this press, so I will mention the couple drawbacks. Changing the speed is a little inconvenient because you actually need to manually move the gear belts around. But my biggest gripe is the drill press chuck, it did fall off several times during use. However, I believe much of this could be resolved if I cleaned the chuck a bit and used more force in securing the chuck.
customer_reviews.author: gogogadget

customer_reviews.title: Little annoying quirks but this drill totally works.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent press for the money. Hasn’t failed me yet. My only issues. The depth gauge gets loose all the time. The base plate is annoying, as it has to be loosened to move up and down. When loosened it drops too fast and gravity forces it to stall when pushed up, it’s annoying. It also spins when it’s loosened, takes getting used to. Also the lowering handles constantly need to be tightened as the vibration loosens them. Not a big deal until you are focusing on a precise drill and the handle begins to jiggle while lowering the bit. Can take you out of moment. Or maybe it’s just me.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Koch

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine
customer_reviews.text: Good machine for the price. Keep in mind, this isn't a 500 dollar machine. Another thing to remember is that you won't be able to drill past 4 inches because your stock will hit the tube that supports the drill press. Also, love the 5 speeds for different jobs<<<Just keep in mind that you will have to move the drive belt between different pulleys to change the speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Nickels

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Is this a 500 dollar drill press? No. Heck is it even a 160 dollar drill press? No. It's a 90 dollar drill press. So, expect 90 dollar tool issues. Chuck wobble. Misaligned pieces. Narrow range of speed adjustments. Etc. My overall happiness of it...I'd say an 7/10. I paid 90 bucks for it and will have to buy a new chuck, and a magnetic light for it. That will cost about 40 bucks. So, really I am paying almost for the 10 inch that comes with quick adjustment table, laser pointer, and a light. Plus very minimum chuck wobble. If I had to do it all over again. I would have just bought the Porter Cable at Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Renfrow

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for a drawer fronts, don’t think it would hold up with heavier work
customer_reviews.text: This is a budget drill press. This would be great for small projects or crafts. This has a very small table and does not offer much up and down movement. The motor is not designed to run a holesaw or anything else that requires a decent amount of torque. No matter what belt setting I choose I can always hear and bogged down.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: An beginner's drill press
customer_reviews.text: The board to be drilled must be a paper's thickness lower than the tip of the drill. This makes adjusting a little difficult. Belt inside unit was super tight so I couldn't change speeds until I stretched it a bit. If you're a beginner or on a tight budget, this unit will do the job, but if you're heavy into woodworking I suggest a higher cost unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome W. Niemi

customer_reviews.title: nice, but came with wrong sized chuck key.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. However it shipped with a chuck key with the wrong sized tip. It needs a 1/4 inch, but came with one that was larger that and would not fit in any of the holes in the side of the check The gear on the key was correct. I filed it down and made it work since the my local hardware store was out of stock. I would have given 5 stars if it came with the correct chuck key. I'm surprised to see I'm at the only customer complaining about this at this time. Perhaps I'm the first to report a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Larson

customer_reviews.title: REALLY NICE WORKS GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I drill alum .steel and wood .This is a good machine ,Easy to assemble ,You get about 4 handles .They all go on the wheel where you turn to make the bit go down .The base bolts take a 14 MM socket.There is a small allen wrench to tighten the head on the stand pipe.I think I needed a smaller one to do another thing .You clean the chuck inside that mated with the tapered drive shaft ,Use a 2x4 with a hammer to hammer the chuck on the tapered shaft.That is what holds it,It is a good method. all the parts are in a plastic bag.I USE THIS A LOT.
customer_reviews.author: charlie j.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy and perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why the negative comments on this drill press not having enough power. I had it up and running within 15 minutes and drilling through 1/4 inch aluminum was like drilling through butter. I was very surprised after reading some of the negative comments. I didn't even realize at first when I had drilled completely through the first hole. This is probably more drill press then I need as I bought it for drilling out Printed Circuit Boards, aluminium heat sinks and boxes for electronic projects. But so far I am very happy with it. Glad I listened to the vast majority of user reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Go through every adjustment and set screw before you turn it on!
customer_reviews.text: So to be fair the first job I tried on it was 1/4” hardened plate steel. And it was very easy to stall even with cutting oil and a speed setup that maximized torque to the spindle. I did get it done but not without a fight. Go through the entire machine before first use as the tension needs set and the pulley set screws were loose. But all in all I would rather have it than not. Even though it’s not going to handle precision work. And I guess wanting it around is the best value proposition that can be said.
customer_reviews.author: DF_EE

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT recommend...
customer_reviews.text: Came in with bad motor. The problem I have is that I shipped to my home in Panamá and when I tried to use it for the first time it shows lack of power. Couldn't even do a hole on a 1/2" plywood. Very disappointed. Ordering a new motor would cost me $46.13 but not sure if I should want to take a chance and give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Caballo2154

customer_reviews.title: This little guy works great
customer_reviews.text: Tis is a great drill press. I needed a small drill press I could put in my shed and found this one. Yeah it's small and isn't like those super expensive ones that do crazy things but all I need it for is to put straight holes in things and and fit in the shed without taking up so much room and this was perfect. I have drilled like 50 holes so far, different sizes and depth and have had no problems. The depth stop isn't great but it works good enough For less than $100, this thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN MORTON

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this drill press. All metal, easy to assemble. Turned on and motor was quiet and powerful with no shaft/chuck wobble whatsoever, that blew my mind! I've used higher priced presses that looked cheap compared to this one. Not for everyday use but I see myself using this regularly. Nice addition to my ever growing collection.
customer_reviews.author: PTS

customer_reviews.title: A drill for hobbyists - not professionals
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to complain about a $60 drill press... lots of value for the price, but you are going to be limited. The motor got bogged down trying to drill into pine with a 3/8" drill bit. There's probably no way you'll be doing any serious drilling with this machine, but light duty work should be fine. I attached a wire brush and used it to clean some rust off some old tools and this worked great! Don't expect a professional level drill, just for hobbyists...
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money and get the next model up
customer_reviews.text: There's no rack on the column so it takes two hands to adjust the table height. And this means the table rotates as its height is adjusted which further complicates table positioning. Spend the extra money and get the next model up.
customer_reviews.author: NOVA DIYers

customer_reviews.title: High End Quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Dislike the size of the table and base. So I'm going to make new, larger one's using this drill press. Like's, every thing else. When I started the motor for the first time, I was shocked at what I heard. I heard almost no noise from the drill press. Most of the noise came from the vibration because I had not anchored it to my work stand yet. I've worked in metal stamping and tool and die all of my life. The WEN 4208 8" 5 speed drill press in my opinion is a better drill press than some that cost five times more. Buy it. It's a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Madd Dogg

customer_reviews.title: Wobble wobble wobble
customer_reviews.text: The shaft and shuck constantly wobble it’s not very accurate they replaced it once but the one they replaced it with has the exact same problem what good is a drill press if it’s gonna wobble all over the place and not give you accurate holes
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Peter T. Dixon D.B.S.

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable first drill press
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling to drill straight holes in steel and decided to purchase this entry level drill press. My expectations were exceeded and this little drill press will have a place in my shop as long as it lasts. Easily assembled with the tools provided and drilled various steel plates, bars, and tubes with ease !
customer_reviews.author: Bkovey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great press for the money. If you're a weekend warrior and light woodworker it's perfect. No you won't drill 3" forstner bits or get high industrial work out of this press but that's not what it was designed for. Easy to assemble in 10 minutes and is light enough to be portable. Shipped for less $0, what are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.author: Shawn E. Decker

customer_reviews.title: love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: i can't say enough about wen products i am so impressed and the price oh my god . thank you wen . this little thing is a dam drill press . i am a mold maker for a glass factory and i use very good tools at work . but this thing is really impressive . i really can't believe its as good as it si for so little money . for the homeowner this and a good vise is all you need . and some good drill bits !!!!!! yes guys lets make sure we are holding down our work piece to the table !!!!!!!! be safe !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: keith h

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press for the price.
customer_reviews.text: What a great drill.oress, for the price. This is not a thousand dollar Delta drill press but it is great for the average Joe in his garage. I've inspected the build quality as I was a bit worried due to other bad reviews. I'm happy to report that they appear to have corrected any manufacturing deficiencies.no rust, no putting in any of the cast iron. It's a solid drill press for my work bench for light duty use. See for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Corbinwaterski

customer_reviews.title: Best little drill press out there.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a nice bigwig floor model drill press in my younger days. But now that I'm a bit older I don't need another one. After many YouTube videos and research I came up with this what I call baby drill press. Well I love it. It was easy to put together. It is pretty darn quiet. The one thing I wanted was a half inch chuck. Darn thing has that also. Well if your like me and don't need the big and fancy, get one of these. Best bang for the buck. There I hope this old farts review helps. Have a Great day.
customer_reviews.author: Calla F.

customer_reviews.title: Saving me a bunch of bits
customer_reviews.text: Still a recent purchase, but this is my first time using a drill press and I'm very happy with the product. It gives me the precision I've always wanted for deep holes and for drilling stainless steel it is unbelievable the difference it makes compared to a hand drill. Consistent pressure and no wobble.. and quiet... Suddenly my bits are lasting much longer. I don't know by how much since I wasn't able to destroy a bit with this equipment yet.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: My Wen 8" Drill Press Is Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2019 to use in an extra room for my leather and other craft work. I use it for drilling leather, wood, metals of all type and anything else that I might find a need for. Not a single thing has ever failed. It's small and perfect for any kind of craft work or other small around-the-home job. It is really useful and being an expert to use it is not necessary... I really use it a lot and am so happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Wethouse

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press for the price.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a drill press and don't have too much room, then this is the one to get. It's small footprint allows you to set it up on any workbench or pedestal. The setup was so easy and the motor is really smooth and quiet. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: Bits wobble a noticeable amount, thus useless.
customer_reviews.text: Why a drill press and not a handheld drill? Simple, to get precision straight holes. So if the drill press wobbles the bit so much a 1.5” bit makes a 1.73” hole, it has failed its primary job spectacularly. (Yeah, I used digital calipers to measure that 1.73”). To be clear, it’s not the bit. I’ve tried multiple bits and I’ve tried reseating the chuck (always according to instructions), with no luck. I thought this task of a straight hole in wood was so simple even a cheap machine could get it right. I was wrong. Shame on me I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Earendil

customer_reviews.title: Does the job...
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together, despite the somewhat intimidating need to clean the chuck with acetone before attaching it to the drive shaft. Once together it did a really nice job, I also liked the yellow safety key to make sure no one runs without supervision. It seems heavy and well made - hopefully it will last a few years. Good price. I can't believe how much some of it's competitors are sold for.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you can't beat it. Slow and steady wins the race with this. Step drill bits are a challenging when drilling into thick pieces of metal but that's about it. I use this nearly daily and it has plenty of power for drilling metal up to 3/8 inch with a 1/2 inch bit. After that it's slow as to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel E

customer_reviews.title: Closer to a toy than a tool
customer_reviews.text: You think it is going to help you with your projects but from the start your expectations steadily s dwindle until you are left regretting your purchase of this everything-almost-works-well-but-doesn't not-a-tool gadget. I won't be buying Wen again.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: I spent an hour and a half and three boards trying to get some bolts to align with my drill and still was a no go. It took me 10 minutes and 1 try to get them working with this press. The assembly is a little weird as you literally just hammer the chuck onto the shaft (no lock in screws or anything to hold it) but it seems to work and for $88, I'll take it all day long!!
customer_reviews.author: devino

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Likes- easy to use , runs smooth, portable. Dislikes-work piece table is held at different heights by a threaded handle . The more expensive model has a geared adjuster that adjusts the table up or down. I wish I had bought that model. The threaded piece on my table broke off, and they sent me a new piece under warranty. It could have been a casting defect. I use mine a lot. Don't know how I drilled a straight hole without it
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Its inexpensive and does the job but....
customer_reviews.text: This drill press will drill small straight holes. The depth is a max of 2 inches so you can't drill deep. If you use a blade bit only the point will go that deep. It is 5 speeds, but its not a turn of a dial to change the speed. You have to release the tension on the belt, move the belt and then re-tension the belt. The whole in the table will only allow for you to drill about a 5/8's inch hole.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Looked OK. But not.
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this, then went out of country and the return window closed before I came back. So I used it a few times on light work and the chuck fell off. It does not appear anything except friction held it on. I shoved it back on and then after a couple of uses the chuck became inoperative. This time I had to pound it off, looking for a new chuck, feels like a waste of money so far....
customer_reviews.author: zozomike

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent value for a drill press
customer_reviews.text: I have had this drill press for 2 years and I have used it on hardwood, soft wood, and metal (slowly) successfully. The drill press has good castings. The range of RPMs is more than sufficient for garage projects and at home hobbyists. If I could ask for an improvement it would be the ability to drill to a greater depth and for a larger table. I use 1/2" MDF to create a larger sacrificial table and it works great. Make sure all hardware is snug during assembly, but do not over-tighten. A great value and hardworking tool. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a drill press
customer_reviews.text: No wobble in the chuck. The springloaded chuck key is annoying but it's not stripping out so i guess the design is good. The belt drive cover handle rattles when running and the base sucks phallic members for holding a vice. Wish the base were flat on the bottom. Pretty good power. 5 forward speeds are nice to have even if there's no reverse. Also it'd be nice if the base had a rail of steps and teeth instead of being set-screwed on a polished shaft. It doesn't stay centered by itself. But this was like $80 and no functional problems so 5/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little unit - emphasis on little. It's sorely under powered. The first project I used it for was a small candle holder centerpiece out of walnut. Brand new carbon forstner bit - but this drill press could not handle the task, It either stopped or overheated. Ended up building a jog and using my cordless Makita to finish the work. Not exactly apiece of junk but it SHOULD be able to drill holes in wood. That will teach me to try to go cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Springer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build - smaller than I expected but got the job done. Chuck was a little wobbly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not very large but I guess its the first drill press ive bought. Ive always inherited drill press' from other people. Assembly was easy enough. When I put the chuck on i used a rubber mallet instead of a hammer and wood. Im not sure if that caused the issue but the video shows a little wobble in the chuck. Im not sure if the wobble is only in the tightening part or goes down to the drill bit. Either way made a nice hole in my steel and seems to get the job done for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Lite duty
customer_reviews.text: It is built lightly. It lack power. When drilling 1/2" hole on 1/4 plate, the bits would bind. the moter would get warm. I had to use 3 different size new bits. The motor would warm up. This suggest to me that it will fail with heavy usage. The chuck binds. The small size is a plus. Because of this, I am going to keep it and try to adapt a more powerful motor.
customer_reviews.author: Louis S.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Would be better if it was stronger than my hand drill. Weak. Second (and last) Wen product for me. The table dancer that I got will not hold a belt, and this thing can't even drill through chip board... I am done with them...
customer_reviews.author: zkro6087

customer_reviews.title: Issues from the start.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect anything too great for the price, but I expected it to function properly. Assembled it and went to drill some test holes but the motor would just hum. Took the belt off and the motor would still only hum. I have it some help and it started to work, but this motor is hot. 2 stars because it’s working for now. I can’t see the motor lasting too long and I’ll have to return.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Gault

customer_reviews.title: Mini-me for a real drill press
customer_reviews.text: It’s a “drill press” and it’s cheap — I’ll give it that. It has hardly any torque, however, which means it will bog down when attempting anything more than basic stuff. I was hoping to use it with a small hole saw or Forstner to drill into cedar. It couldn’t handle it. I’m past the return date. Maybe it will make a nice spindle sander. :-/
customer_reviews.author: NCWoodSmith

customer_reviews.title: How can you beat an 8" Drill Press for <$100 shipped!
customer_reviews.text: 10 minutes of assembly (manual not exactly on point) and off we go drilling 1/2" galvanized steel! Hard to believe this was less than $100 delivered next day, and still has 5 speeds. Actually quite sturdy, all things considering. The chuck holder barely holds the chuck, and tilting the tray is a bit odd, but for the price to value, this is very very very hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Did not work and was new and it was a dud. Waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. Did not run. Used the same extension cord and circuit I use to run a Ryobi BT3000 table saw and the motor on the WEN would only hum. Their Manual says a 18 gauge extension cord at 25 ft. Same cord I use for my Ryobi on a 13 amp circuit and nothing. No other items on the circuit too. I researched it on Amazon and so many good reviews. Not sure how, but I got a dud. Did not want to take a chance on another one - so return. Waste of time. At least Amazon customer service was great and sent a return label right away. Back to searching for a new drill press.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Would like a bit larger table
customer_reviews.text: Press came well packaged and assembly was direct and went without hitch. Bit challenging to install drill chuck into arbor. Would like a bit larger table. Don't want to attach to table so seems a bit tipsy without securing it to something; clamps seem to be acceptable for now. Maybe I'll find a permanent place to mount it. Changing drill speeds takes some getting use to. Loosen motor, slip belt between pulleys then tighten motor. However, price was right for the use I have for it. It is light duty at best.
customer_reviews.author: howard mcallister

customer_reviews.title: Great on wood, limited accuracy on harder materials
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill press for setting up concealed hinges, which require using a 35mm forstner bit. This press worked great on wood. For a later project, where I had to put some holes in a stainless steel plate, I notice there was a lot of drill bit deflection. Bottom line: a great drill press for the money, especially on wood, It has limited accuracy when it comes to metal or harder materials.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Missing key feature
customer_reviews.text: If you need a cheap drill press that is easy to assemble and works out of the box, this Wen is fine- HOWEVER, this model does not have a independent height adjustment. That is a critical feature for using a drill press for almost all work. The next model up DOES have this feature. Spend the extra money and get the 10" model. Another important note is that this model is not compatible with common drill press clamps (the table is too small), which is also very important.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Would not drill through aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to drill through aluminum 80% receiver. Tried all speeds with cobalt bits and the moment the bit comes in contact with the aluminum the bit stops. Would not recommend this drill press.
customer_reviews.author: KPatriotH

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck light duty drill press
customer_reviews.text: A good value for a light duty home use drill press. It’s fairly accurate, I’d even say it’s as accurate as you’d need for any home projects. There is some runout but it’s negligible and completely expected for the price. Belt changes are simple, but the belt is low quality. It may work itself in a bit, but it does seem to slip easily even with proper tension. Overall this drill press is a good value for a hobbyist or homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a small Drill Press
customer_reviews.text: Bought refurbished, and it came loose in a general Amazon box, I was concerned that pieces might be missing, but all were there and it went together quickly and easily. Works well, reasonably quiet and accurate enough for my small garage shop. The belts/gears came in the loose position, as if I were going to adjust them to a different speed, but I was able to easily tighten them up for use. I think this may be the cause for some of the rattling that was reported in other reviews since this was not noted in the build instructions. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Troy DuBois

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble. The table needed minor adjustments to zero it and level it. Comes preset at 1530 rpm which for the test piece of 3/16 stainless it was perfect. A good sharp bit some cutting oil and little pressure drilled a 3/16 hole with ease. Chuck has zero wobble when installed properly it won’t move a dial indicator while spinning nor did it while cutting with lite pressure let the machine and the bit do the work. It’s very quiet and very smooth. I’m ver happy I chose this wen 8” press over others I looked at. It’s a great product at a very reasonable price. Nothing on this machine is made of low quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Chad S.

customer_reviews.title: Don'
customer_reviews.text: This thing is horrible. DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!!! When I assembled it I barely bump there on off switch and it broke off. Then when I did get to use it on my lower polymer receiver the depth adjustment broke off and went to deep on my lower receiver. Not only did I loose $80 on my lower receiver cause it messed it up bad I also lost money by buying this terd
customer_reviews.author: joshua housley

customer_reviews.title: Great drill, great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Best deal for a budget drill press, and Wen backs up their products. I had and issue with the table assembly and they had a great rep get back to me after I emailed them and replaced the bad part. Could not be happier with their service and products. I bought a small bench grinder from them as well for polishing my knives and it is also doing great for my needs! Thanks Wen for being amazing.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: A tremendous value
customer_reviews.text: This drill press is extremely inexpensive, but you'd never know it by using it. The spindle spins perfectly, the handle operates smoothly and the overall feeling is that of a well-designed, quality piece of equipment. I was skeptical of all the great reviews when I saw the price, but they were accurate and I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. James

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the hobbyist/homeowner
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small projects. There are times when a hand held drill is not accurate enough. This press is inexpensive and fits atop my work bench. If I had more room and wanted to spend more money a floor standing press would be nice but for the hobbyist this is perfect. btw, my bro-in-law has the similarly priced one from Harbor Freight and this Wen is nicer.
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: The entire machine flexes
customer_reviews.text: Drilling into alloy steel always requires a bit of pressure. Applying pressure on the drill bit to cut metal causes both the table and the tool head to flex away from each other. This machine is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Quickshot

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little drill press for the price. Assembled it in 15 minutes and drilled through hole in a 2x4 expecting to have to shim the post or base. Hole was a perfect 90 feg from surface of the wood. Then chucked a 1-1/4” forstner bit and drilled through and was pleasantly surprised to experience no stoppage or bog down. Great small press for the price. I used to think Wen was junk but I saw quite a few good reviews recently regarding their tools which caused me to make this purchase. Glad I did, I will be considering Wen tools more in the future for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for any job that will fit.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill press, regardless of the info. The price nearly ran me off but, I bit and ordered. So glad I did. Drilled a few holes testing it for power and speed....perfect!
customer_reviews.author: CoolTXman

customer_reviews.title: A gem
customer_reviews.text: This drill press is a gem. I never expected to get this quality in a small, inexpensive tool. I mounted it to a 2 x 4 box so I could clamp it to my workbench when I needed it and it performs very well. I am no expert, but there appears to be no runout and no issues so far. One of the best purchases in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Davis

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well built drill press
customer_reviews.text: After cleaning it I installed the chuck. It is staying in quite well. There is a little runout. I'm using it for wood working , so I haven't tested it on metal. I drilled a 1" hole in a 2x4 using a spade bit on lowest speed without any problems. I drilled a 1/2" through the 2x4 using a 1/2" drill bit without any problems. The runout is negligible with the bit. The table takes a little work to get it perpendicular and has to be adjusted each time the height is changed. I am quite satisfied with it as a hobby tool.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Good drill press
customer_reviews.text: My first drill press. Worked on my intended use which was to drill straight holes into wood bases to erect heavy resin collectible figures on with a thin glass rod. It was easy to figure out and assemble; however, the changing the speed thing was tricky. I still need to figure that out. Perhaps, I didn’t loosen the knob all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Quyen Dinh

customer_reviews.title: very nice little press for the hobby/ DIY kind of person
customer_reviews.text: very nice little press for the hobby/ DIY kind of person. it has a fairly small work bed and doesn't take up a huge footprint on the table but the motor seems sturdy and the ability to change the belt drive gearing is nice as well. putting it together was very easy ( yes some assembly required!) i wish it had more distance between the work surface and chuck, but it is as advertised so i cant take any points away for that. overall very happy with this drill press
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: You get exactly what you pay for - 3 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad and not great either. Feels like decent quality Chine mfg. Easy to put together. I was drilling a very hard stainless steel rod with moderate to heavy downward pressure. The swivel plate had a few mm of downward deflection. Not a concern with what I was doing but if you need something very precise, try a more heavy duty unit. If you are working with wood or mild steel, this unit is fine. Much better then the Harbor Freight units that are similarly priced.
customer_reviews.author: john cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. Just wish it came with a vice and didn’t have sharp metal shards. When trying assemble the drill press together, I should have worn work gloves. I got small pieces of metal stuck in my hand a few times. But over all, love the item and it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A piece of machinery
customer_reviews.text: This is a legit drill press for small to medium projects. It's very durable and the components are much better than the other drill presses in the same class.. Very impressed and would definitely by another WEN product off Amazon.. If you have any doubt, just search for comparisons between this machine and any other machine (in the same class) that you are considering .. the other machine won't compare..
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: A little Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for; this is a cheap drill press that works ok on thin material while drilling small holes, but really struggles to drill steel of 1/4" or thicker mild steel, with bits larger than 3/8", or so. Motor bogs down easily, chatters and will even stall if you supply even moderate feed input. At the end of the day, your intended use will dictate your experience with this machine, if you are drilling thin, soft metals, or wood, you should be fine, but I would not recommend this machine, if you are attempting any sort of steel fabrication, spend a few bucks more to get a drill with more power.
customer_reviews.author: Cayce

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. Great for lighter woodworking jobs. Will do metal pretty good with a good bit. Speed adjustment is a little clumsy and the cover over the belt and pulley system it uses is a little flimsy. Overall very satisfied with this and other products I have purchased from this company.
customer_reviews.author: AJF

customer_reviews.title: Good value but don’t expect too much.
customer_reviews.text: Once set up this is an accurate drill press for the DIY’r. There has been a time or two that I needed a little more capacity with regard to drilling a hole. By the time I added the drill bit and the object to be drilled, the drill wouldn’t extend far enough to drill as deep as I needed. It will usually do what I need it to do, but not always.
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: I’m an amateur woodworker and, of my modest collection of power tools, I really love this drill press. It’s quiet, easy to assemble, and drills nice, clean holes. So far I’ve found the accuracy to meet my needs and, when drilling a taller workpiece, was able to spin the table out of the way to give several more inches of clearance. Maybe it’s because it’s so much quieter than every other power tool I own, but this is probably the most satisfying tool to use. If you need a drill press, I can’t see why you would regret this purchase. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Leaky3

customer_reviews.title: Great, minimalist bench drill.
customer_reviews.text: Pros *Cost *Easy to put together and use in minutes *lightweight, easy enough for most people to move it around the shop. Cons* * I dont like how the bed tilts by tightening and untightening a large bolt underneath. * There is a handle that allows you to release the bed but it slides and requires 2 hands to change. Would much rather have a crank up and down bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth and quiet. Surprisingly high quality for the price. I've been using it as a buffer quite a bit since I got it and there seems to be enough torque to tackle about any job you would require of a machine this size. I believe that I will try some more of Wen's power tools as I recreate a mini version of my big shop in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t need a drill press for a lot of things but I had this huge, old floor model and needed to move it over gravel to a new shed. That wasn’t going to happen. So I sold it and bought this table top model. Five speeds is enough for me and I’ve used it several times now. The first time, though,, the chuck came off the spindle. Apparently I read the directions wrong during installation. I re-read the instructions and got installed correctly with no problems since. So far it does everything I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ward

customer_reviews.title: Can be used for light drilling. Weak.
customer_reviews.text: Good little machine for small jobs. It is not very strong and stalls frequently even under light pressure. Works okay with drill bits but does not work for hole saws of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great drill press for just $85
customer_reviews.text: I have a real small workshop @ 8'-5"x8'-5" so I am limited to smaller tools and projects. This Wen 8" drill press fits perfectly in my shop and does just what I need it to do. Made a nice little fence courtesy of Steve Ramsey. Coudn't be happier at this price. No trouble assembling, took about 20 minutes. Fired right up and made swiss cheese outta my piece of wood. 5/8" spade bit...ppffftt right through a 2x4. Works for me, your milage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: DanO

customer_reviews.title: VERY CHEAP AND FLIMSY
customer_reviews.text: Not very well made or of good quality. So incredible how cheap this is. This is not an accurate drill press what so ever; wobble and slop in the machining everywhere. The chuck is just hammered in and depending on how you hammered it in depends on how much wobble you will get on your drilling.
customer_reviews.author: SecretAsianMan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome press! I'm by no means an expert, I just needed something that would make drilling holes in hardened steel easier after the step bit I bought to use with my handheld drill snapped at the tip. I'm drilling 3/8" cold rolled steel with this thing, and as long as I'm taking my time+using cutting oil with the right bits, it's getting the job done. And for $80? Wow. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

product_meta.title: WEN 4208 8 in. 5-Speed Drill Press
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:Drill PressRemember when power tools were actually powerful? WEN’s 8-inch swing, 5-speed drill press is small but powerful enough to drill through metal, wood, plastics, and other materials. Max drill capacity is 1/2” in 1” thick cast iron. When you need accurate, repeatable holes, this tool will do the job more conveniently and precisely than a hand held drill. The perfect size for the shop and portable enough to take to the job. Constructed with a rigid frame consisting of cast iron: head, table, and base ensuring accurate holes. Its powerful induction motor features ball bearings for an extended life and it all comes together with smooth and balanced performance even at high speeds. The ½” chuck with JT33 spindle taper gives you versatility with a variety of bits. Worktable bevels 45° left and right for those tricky operations for the perfect right angles consistently. The base contains predrilled holes for mounting onto a bench or work stand. The slotted table allows for mounting clamps and vises for effective workholding. Since 1951, WEN has proudly produced innovative powered tools focused on value delivering meaningful features that will help you complete and enjoy the work as much as the project. Remember when you could drill holes in any material with ease? Remember WEN.
feature_bullets: Includes a 1/2-inch keyed chuck and onboard key storage
Spindle travels up to 2 inches with easy to read, locking linear depth stops for accurate and repeatable drilling operations.Cord Length (ft.):6
Durable 1/3 HP induction motor develops ample torque and power
6-1/2 x 6-1/2" worktable is height adjustable and bevels up to 45 degrees left & right
